title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 April 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:05 <vmassol> has quit  
00:37 <polx> has quit  
04:33 <DrLou\_> has quit  
07:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:01 <Denis> has quit  
07:32 <npm> has quit  
07:36 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
08:02 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <polx> has quit  
08:43 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:43 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <+Denis> sdumitriu: I am starting to have something working, that properly manage all tables, including custom mapped ones, like feeds\_\*  
10:00 <+Denis> sdumitriu: is the standard change types the right stuff to do for Oracle ?  
10:02 <+Denis> sburjan`: You have tested from 2.7.x…. could you tell me if you have feeds\_\* tables as well, I imagine that you have, but I am not sure. I would be nice not to have them empty for having a good test  
10:06 <+sburjan`> Denis: I only looked at the console, didn't go deeper  
10:07 <+Denis> sburjan`: I have absolutely no idea of the usage of these table  
10:08 <+Denis> but these are a good exemple of complex custom mapped objects  
10:08 <+sburjan`> I think that table is used for Activity Stream  
10:08 <+sburjan`> anyway, bbl  
10:09 <+Denis> no, these are older, I know it is related to feed plugin, I wonder if it was not about the old XWiki Watch  
10:09 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <CIA-160> Vincent Massol master \* r902507e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/902507e8aa6c602bd0422a753ed2a0fa5dd2d909 / (3 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7737: Send WikiReadyEvent event when a wiki is ready to be used ...  
10:51 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <polx> has quit  
10:59 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <CIA-160> Denis Gervalle master \* rc14eff6 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c14eff6f37cc539fc7da68ccf4146c428b25ae4c / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/migration/hibernate/R40000XWIKI6990DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7729: IDs migration fails due to foreign key constraints - http://git.io/J021ow  
11:05 <CIA-160> Denis Gervalle stable-4.0.x \* rf81f1a2 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f81f1a22731a8881c64bf2287f7d389693aa1670 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/migration/hibernate/R40000XWIKI6990DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7729: IDs migration fails due to foreign key constraints ...  
11:14 <polx> has quit  
11:41 <vmassol> Hi guys  
11:42 <vmassol> next time someone does a commit you'll have a surprise :)  
11:55 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <polx> has quit  
12:11 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <Denis> has quit  
12:24 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
12:24 <vmassol> just did a commit, check the mailing list, see anything different from before? ;)  
12:25 <@cjd> hey, patches are back, awesome  
12:26 <vmassol> yep :)  
13:04 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <abusenius> has quit  
13:11 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:25 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:19 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <jvelo> has quit  
14:40 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <Lalit> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <Lalit> Hello Xwiki user and developer, I want to build a custom authorization mechanism using our existing role matrix stored in database and want to authenticate using the Active directory. Could you please suggest what approach should I take ? Thanks  
15:26 <blackbird\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:27 <blackbird\_> hi there, how do I rename a applicationwithinaminute item? (regular page renaming does not work in my case)  
15:29 <+evalica> I think it works - maybe you need to change the title of the page?  
15:30 <+evalica> blackbird\_:  the livetable displays page titles - not names  
15:32 <+evalica> blackbird\_: I take back what I said - the livetable shown page names - sorry  
15:32 <+evalica> so the rename should work.  
15:32 <+Denis> Lalit: have your read this http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication ?  
15:37 <+Denis> sburjan: I just finished testing this latest build http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/4.1-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-4.1-20120417.103019-17.zip  
15:37 <+sburjan> on which db ?  
15:38 <+Denis> this is the standalone, jetty+hsqldb  
15:38 <+sburjan> have you tested the migration also ?  
15:38 <+Denis> I have also tested MySQL/MyIsam and MySQL/InnoDB with  success  
15:38 <+Denis> only the migration :)  
15:38 <+sburjan> if not, I can test tomorrow on all db's, can't do it now because I am very busy  
15:39 <+Denis> we still have an issue with Oracle, but all others should work now  
15:40 <+Denis> ping me if you got any unexpected issue, but will be mostly off tomorrow  
15:41 <+sburjan> okay  
15:41 <+Denis> I hope sdumitriu will be able to fix Oracle by tomorrow as well  
15:42 <+sburjan> did we fix postgres on 3.5.1 ?  
15:43 <+Denis> I don't kown, what was the issue ?  
15:44 <+sburjan> failing migration :)  
15:45 <+Denis> mm, oh, yes I remember sdumitriu mixup the mapping, it shoud be fixed  
15:45 <+sburjan> ook fixed, at least on jira  
15:46 <Lalit> Thanks Denis  
15:46 <+Denis> he had taken the mapping from 4.x in 3.5, which is cleary no compatible  
15:53 <+Denis> Enygma`: Would you mind if I fix the warning in 40001 migration ?  
15:56 <+Enygma`> Denis: what warning?  
15:56 <+Denis> the one in the jira issue from Sorin  
15:57 <+Enygma`> about object class references?  
15:57 <+Denis> yep  
15:58 <+Denis> you should use relative one in getMigratedObject  
15:58 <+Enygma`> if you wish, go ahead  
15:59 <+Enygma`> but It`s not ok IMO to throw a warning if the object class reference contains a wiki reference which is \*the same\* as the current wiki  
15:59 <+Enygma`> it polutes the console uselessly  
16:00 <+Denis> agreed, but it is useless to use absolute reference there as well, the warning has be added to detect such misusage, and should be removed on release  
16:00 <Lalit> Hello , I am unable to checkout xwiki-platform from github on my windows machine.Its probably due to the long path names - any idea how to resolve this ? any workaround ?  
16:01 <+Enygma`> Denis: actually, I`ve found it quite cumbersome to create local references  
16:01 <+Enygma`> actually, I still am unsure of what is the right way  
16:02 <+Enygma`> since new DocumentReference(null, space, page) throws an IllegalArgumentException  
16:02 <+Denis> EntityReference xwikiCommentsClassReference =  
16:02 <+Denis>                 new EntityReference("XWikiComments", EntityType.DOCUMENT,  
16:02 <+Denis>                     new EntityReference("XWiki", EntityType.SPACE));  
16:03 <+Denis> or use a resolver, but it is IMO too much there  
16:03 <+Enygma`> So we need a new constructor for DocumentReference  
16:03 <+Denis> not really, a DocumentReference is always absolute  
16:03 <+Enygma`> since using EntityReference looks like a workaround to me  
16:04 <+Enygma`> so a (local EntityReference) != (DocumentReferene without a parent) ?  
16:05 <+Enygma`> now I understand why I could not figure out how to create a local DocumentReference :))  
16:05 <+Denis> A document reference always has all parents upto the wiki  
16:05 <+Denis> this is what a DocumentReference ensure compare to an EntityReference  
16:06 <+Enygma`> well, you have to admit that it is a bit confusing... since you actually want to create a DocumentReference (at least in you mind)  
16:06 <+Enygma`> do we have any of this documented? (no sarcasm, just curious :) )  
16:07 <+Denis> In the javadoc at least, AFAIK  
16:08 <+Enygma`> DocumentReference: "Represents a reference to a document (wiki, space and page names)."  
16:08 <+Denis> Honestly, after the abandon of the inter wiki classes, I was in favor of removing all usage of relative reference, and ensure class and document wiki stay in sync, but Thomas an Vincent has never agree  
16:09 <blackbird\_> evalica: I understand, but \_how\_ do I change the name/title?  
16:12 <+Enygma`> Denis: I would agree with you. I also find relative references to be troublesome. The only place where they are vital is when you serialize them into page XML (i.e. for XAR export), but that more to do with serializers than references.  
16:15 <+Denis> Enygma`: FYI, I have added EntityReference#removeParent(EntityReference), but I admit that this is still cumbersome to use. ie myRelativeEntityReference = myDocumentReference.remove(myDocumentReference.getWikiReference());  
16:15 <+Denis> s/remove/removeParent/  
16:20 <vmassol> Enygma`: we ddn't have relative ref initially. We didn't want them!  
16:20 <vmassol> but they were needed and we were asked to add them  
16:21 <vmassol> to support the use case of having a template wiki for example  
16:21 <vmassol> (still otp)  
16:21 <+Enygma`> vmassol: WDYM by template wiki? What problems occurred there?  
16:22 <vmassol> if you store a full ref in the DB  
16:22 <vmassol> when you copy  
16:22 <vmassol> the wiki  
16:22 <+Enygma`> but you do not store refs in the DB  
16:22 <+Enygma`> you store serialized refs  
16:22 <+Enygma`> it`s just a matter of using the right serializer  
16:22 <+Enygma`> the code of the template was bad, not the absolute references.  
16:23 <+Enygma`> (or we need to supply a $services.model.serializeLocally(...) method)  
16:23 <vmassol> no  
16:23 <vmassol> because we also support creating multi wiki links  
16:24 <vmassol> so we need to differentiate between an absolute ref and a relative ref  
16:24 <vmassol> (we already have that serializer btw Enygma`)  
16:25 <+Denis> what I said, is just that since we do not support interwiki classe anymore, these are now useless there  
16:25 <vmassol> exactly, I wanted to remove them and you disagreed! ;)  
16:25 <vmassol> because you said people might be using them  
16:26 <vmassol> and I said it's not possible becuase it's not working!  
16:26 <vmassol> and you said, still they could think it's working...  
16:27 <+Denis> really, but I said that if you do not want to support it, there no more need for them anywhere in that code, and you disagree with Thomas, and you have exposed the relative reference, which was not exposed before  
16:30 <+Enygma`> vmassol: multi-wiki links... using references?  
16:30 <+Enygma`> can you please give me an example?  
16:31 <vmassol> the feature is called "copy by reference" afaik  
16:31 <vmassol> you should ask thomas about it, I'm not an expert on the wiki manager module  
16:32 <+evalica> blackbird\_: if you what to rename the application's name - this is not possible yet. If you want to rename an application entry just use from the top menu: Page -> Rename  
16:32 <vmassol> blackbird\_: yep you'll need to rename all pages one by one ATM  
16:33 <CIA-160> Denis Gervalle master \* rba19c14 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ba19c140582cb71a46a2015706524426cc151d24 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-annotations/xwiki-platform-annotation-io/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/io/internal/migration/hibernate/R40001XWIKI7540DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7727 Remove warning about absolute XClass reference during Annotation migration - http://git.io/lTKNjQ  
16:33 <+Enygma`> vmassol: ok, never heard of it, but will ask Thomas. Thanks.  
16:35 <vmassol> AFAIR Enygma` it means that you can have some pages in the template for which their content is not copied but instead  a link to the template is done  
16:35 <vmassol> thus allowing to maintain some content in a central location in a farm  
16:35 <vmassol> (whereas a content copy means you loose any chance of updating the content in a central location)  
16:36 <CIA-160> Denis Gervalle stable-4.0.x \* rd88a488 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/d88a488f5a7099e8fa41ec10679d2eb48eb63334 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-annotations/xwiki-platform-annotation-io/src/main/java/org/xwiki/annotation/io/internal/migration/hibernate/R40001XWIKI7540DataMigration.java : XWIKI-7727 Remove warning about absolute XClass reference during Annotation migration ...  
16:37 <+Enygma`> vmassol: I think that is a feature of the ApplicationManager application (which is pretty much deprecated), but will have to check. I remember seeing this somewhere. So the problem lies in the actual linking process, AFAIU.  
16:38 <vmassol> yeah might app manager and not wiki manager  
16:38 <vmassol> s/might/might be/  
16:38 <+Enygma`> thanks Denis  
16:38 <+Denis> vmassol, Enygma`: from what I know, this was a feature of the application manager, and the reference is made using the #include macro; this is quite old.  
16:39 <+Denis> never use it really  
16:44 <+Denis> Enygma`: you are welcome, as I said in the issue, if authors of liquibase is an issue, open another one, thanks :)  
16:49 <Shaddox> has joined #xwiki
